item.title: Non-Causal Associations - Reasons and Examples
item.description: One phrase you heard in your probability class is that correlation does not imply causation. Later, you came across the the popular association between ice-cream and drowning numbers, you instantly recall that does not mean the ice-cream is the cause of the drowning. But, how can you explain the existence of the association? In this blog post, various interpretation of the non-casual associations is listed and explained. The code snippets used are in this notebook
